senses.de: To report one's arrival, typically at a hotel or airport
senses.ex: We will check in at the hotel at 3pm.

Tips.title: Travel Protocol
Tips.description: Used in travel-related situations as part of standard procedures for verifying one's presence.
Tips.example: We must check in at the airport counter before going through security.

Tips.title: Time Specific
Tips.description: 'Check in' often denotes a specific time to report arrival and can coincide with formalities.
Tips.example: Guests are required to check in between 4pm and 6pm.

senses.de: To investigate, look into, or examine
senses.ex: I'll check in on that issue for you.

Tips.title: Concern or Update
Tips.description: Conveys an act of care or the need to update oneself on a situation or person.
Tips.example: After the surgery, the nurse came to check in on his recovery.

Tips.title: Casual Inquiry
Tips.description: Used in casual or informal contexts, showing interest in someone's condition or work.
Tips.example: I'll check in with you later to see how you're feeling.

senses.de: To make contact with someone, especially to ascertain their situation or well-being
senses.ex: I call to check in on my grandmother every weekend.

Tips.title: Regular Communication
Tips.description: Suggests routine or habitual contacting to maintain communication or reassurance.
Tips.example: She likes to check in with her team every morning.

Tips.title: Remote Care
Tips.description: Indicates a way to remotely ensure someone's well-being, often out of concern.
Tips.example: Please check in with your elderly neighbors during the heatwave.

senses.de: To commit (code into a repository) in software development
senses.ex: Please check in your changes before you leave for the day.

Tips.title: Work Habit
Tips.description: In computing, it highlights a routine part of the work process to maintain project continuity.
Tips.example: Team members are expected to check in their code by the end of each day.

Tips.title: Collaboration
Tips.description: Emphasizes teamwork and sharing progress by updating a shared repository.
Tips.example: When you check in your part of the project, please ensure it’s well-documented.
